repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
## Problem

Disabling netrw breaks the spellfile auto-download feature.

## Solution

Migrate the spell file download logic from Vimscript to Lua, removing the dependency on netrw. 
- Add tests
- Use `vim.net.request()` for downloading spellfiles instead of `:Nread` (netrw).

Closes #7189

comment_data.body: Since `plugin/` files are loaded unconditionally on startup, they should not eagerly `require` optional modules. Instead, use `require('vim.net').request(...)` within the functions so that the module is only pulled in when something is actually downloaded.

comment_data.body: This file should live in `runtime/lua/nvim/`. It's not part of the `vim.*` stdlib, it's just a plugin.

The old code referenced `&encoding` because the 'encoding' option of Vim is configurable. In Nvim it's always utf-8. So I think we don't need this parameter at all.

If you want to keep the logic as-is, you can set `local encoding = 'utf-8'` at the top of this module. But it shouldn't be a public config setting.

@@ -0,0 +1,166 @@
+local n = require('test.functional.testnvim')()
+local exec_lua = n.exec_lua
+
+describe('vim.spellfile', function()
+  before_each(function()
+    n:clear()
+  end)
+
+  it('no-op when .spl and .sug already exist', function()
+    local out = exec_lua([[
+      local spellfile = require('vim.spellfile')
+
+      spellfile.config.rtp = { '/rtp' }
+      vim.fn.fnamemodify = function(p, _) return p end
+      vim.fn.isdirectory = function(p) return p == '/rtp/spell' and 1 or 0 end
+      if vim.uv then
+        vim.uv.fs_access = function(_,_) return true end
+      else
+        vim.loop.fs_access = function(_,_) return true end
+        vim.uv = vim.loop
+      end
+
+      local FS = {
+        ['/rtp/spell/en_gb.utf-8.spl'] = { type='file', size=111 },
+        ['/rtp/spell/en_gb.utf-8.sug'] = { type='file', size=222 },
+      }
+      if vim.uv then
+        vim.uv.fs_stat = function(p) return FS[p] end
+      else
+        vim.loop.fs_stat = function(p) return FS[p] end
+        vim.uv = vim.loop
+      end
+
+      local prompted = false
+      vim.fn.input = function() prompted = true; return 'n' end
+
+      local requests = 0
+      local orig_net = vim.net
+      vim.net = vim.net or {}
+      vim.net.request = function(...) requests = requests + 1 end
+
+      spellfile.load_file('en_gb')
+
+      vim.net = orig_net
+      return { prompted = prompted, requests = requests }
+    ]])
+
+    assert.is_false(out.prompted)
+    assert.are.same(0, out.requests)
+  end)
+
+  it('downloads UTF-8 .spl to fallback dir, sug 404 is non-fatal, reloads', function()
+    local out = exec_lua([[
+      local spellfile = require('vim.spellfile')
+
+      spellfile.config.rtp = { '/rtp1', '/rtp2' }
+      vim.fn.fnamemodify = function(p, _) return p end
+      vim.fn.isdirectory = function(_) return 0 end
+      vim.fn.stdpath = function(k) assert(k=='data'); return '/tmp' end
+      vim.fn.mkdir = function(_) return 1 end
+      if vim.uv then
+        vim.uv.fs_access = function(_,_) return false end
+      else
+        vim.loop.fs_access = function(_,_) return false end
+        vim.uv = vim.loop
+      end
+
+      local FS = {}
+      if vim.uv then
+        vim.uv.fs_stat = function(p) return FS[p] end
+      else
+        vim.loop.fs_stat = function(p) return FS[p] end
+        vim.uv = vim.loop
+      end
+
+      vim.fn.input = function() return 'y' end
+
+      local reloaded = false
+      local orig_cmd = vim.cmd
+      vim.cmd = function(c)
+        if c:match('setlocal%s+spell!') then reloaded = true end
+      end
+
+      local orig_net = vim.net
+      vim.net = vim.net or {}
+      vim.net.request = function(url, opts, cb)
+        local name = url:match('/([^/]+)$')
+        if name:find('%.spl$') then
+          FS[opts.outpath] = { type='file', size=123 }
+          cb(nil, { status = 200 })
+        else
+          cb(nil, { status = 404 }) -- .sug missing is OK
+        end
+      end
+
+      spellfile.load_file('en_gb')
+
+      vim.net = orig_net
+      vim.cmd = orig_cmd
+
+      local spl = '/tmp/site/spell/en_gb.utf-8.spl'
+      local sug = '/tmp/site/spell/en_gb.utf-8.sug'
+      return {
+        spl_present = FS[spl] ~= nil,
+        sug_present = FS[sug] ~= nil,
+        reloaded = reloaded,
+      }
+    ]])
+
+    assert.is_true(out.spl_present)
+    assert.is_false(out.sug_present)
+    assert.is_true(out.reloaded)
+  end)
+
+  it('dual-fail: UTF-8 and ASCII 404 -> warn once, mark done, no reload', function()
+    local out = exec_lua([[
+      local spellfile = require('vim.spellfile')
+
+      spellfile.config.rtp = { '/rtp' }
+      vim.fn.fnamemodify = function(p, _) return p end
+      vim.fn.isdirectory = function(_) return 0 end
+      vim.fn.stdpath = function(k) assert(k=='data'); return '/tmp' end
+      vim.fn.mkdir = function(_) return 1 end
+      if vim.uv then
+        vim.uv.fs_access = function(_,_) return false end
+        vim.uv.fs_stat = function(_) return nil end
+      else
+        vim.loop.fs_access = function(_,_) return false end
+        vim.loop.fs_stat = function(_) return nil end
+        vim.uv = vim.loop
+      end
+
+      vim.fn.input = function() return 'y' end
+
+      local warns = 0
+      local orig_notify = vim.notify
+      vim.notify = function(_, lvl)
+        if lvl and lvl >= vim.log.levels.WARN then warns = warns + 1 end
+      end
+
+      local reloaded = false
+      local orig_cmd = vim.cmd
+      vim.cmd = function(c)
+        if c:match('setlocal%s+spell!') then reloaded = true end
+      end
+
+      local orig_net = vim.net
+      vim.net = vim.net or {}
+      vim.net.request = function(_, _, cb) cb(nil, { status = 404 }) end
+
+      local key = spellfile.parse('xx').key
+      spellfile.load_file('xx')
+      local done = spellfile.done[key] == true
+
+      vim.net = orig_net
+      vim.notify = orig_notify
+      vim.cmd = orig_cmd
+
+      return { warns = warns, done = done, reloaded = reloaded }
+    ]])
+
+    assert.are.same(1, out.warns)
+    assert.is_true(out.done)
+    assert.is_false(out.reloaded)

comment_data.body:
where did this come from? `vim.uv` is always available.

if this code is generated by AI, please review it yourself before asking us to review.

comment_data.body:
Testing with mocks like this makes the test extremely brittle: if the plugin code changes, the test may be testing the entirely wrong thing. 

Almost none of our tests use mocks. It is strongly preferred to test actual effects (a file exists, a window was opened, ...) instead of spying on random function calls.

+function M.setup(opts)
+  M._done = {}
+  M.config = vim.tbl_extend('force', M.config, opts or {})
+end
+
+local function notify(msg, level)
+  vim.notify(msg, level or vim.log.levels.INFO)
+end
+
+---@param lang string
+---@return string
+local function normalize_lang(lang)
+  local l = (lang or ''):lower():gsub('-', '_')
+  return (l:match('^[^,%s]+') or l)
+end
+
+local function writable_spell_dirs_from_rtp()
+  local dirs = {}
+  for _, dir in ipairs(rtp_list()) do
+    local spell = vim.fs.joinpath(vim.fn.fnamemodify(dir, ':p'), 'spell')
+    if vim.fn.isdirectory(spell) == 1 and vim.uv.fs_access(spell, 'W') then
+      table.insert(dirs, spell)
+    end
+  end
+  return dirs

+local function default_spell_dir()
+  return vim.fs.joinpath(vim.fn.stdpath('data'), 'site', 'spell')
+end

+local function ensure_target_dir()
+  local dirs = writable_spell_dirs_from_rtp()
+  if #dirs > 0 then
+    return dirs[1]

+  local target = default_spell_dir()
+  if vim.fn.isdirectory(target) ~= 1 then
+    vim.fn.mkdir(target, 'p')
+    notify('Created ' .. target)
+  end
+  return target
+end

+local function http_get_to_file_sync(url, outpath, timeout_ms)
+  local done, err, res = false, nil, nil

comment_data.body:
this should prefer a `stdpath()` dir. looking for "writable dirs in runtimepath" should be a last resort.

I assume this was matching the old logic, but makes more sense to prefer stdpath()

+    notify(
+      ('Could not get %s (status %s): trying %s '):format(
+        spl_utf8,
+        tostring(st or 'nil'),
+        spl_ascii
+      )
+    )
+    local url_ascii = M.config.url .. '/' .. spl_ascii
+    local out_ascii = vim.fs.joinpath(dir, spl_ascii)
+    local ok2, st2, err2 = http_get_to_file_sync(url_ascii, out_ascii, M.config.timeout_ms)
+    if not ok2 then
+      notify(
+        ('No spell file available for %s (utf8:%s ascii:%s)  %s'):format(
+          lang,
+          tostring(st or err or 'fail'),
+          tostring(st2 or err2 or 'fail'),
+          url_utf8
+        ),
+        vim.log.levels.WARN
+      )
+      vim.schedule(function()
+        vim.cmd('echo ""')
+      end)
+      M._done[info.key] = true

comment_regular_data.body: This is way too much code. Please choose the most high-value tests and drop the rest. And we 100% aren't going to add 4 new test files just for spell download.

> This is way too much code. Please choose the most high-value tests and drop the rest. And we 100% aren't going to add 4 new test files just for spell download.

Fair point...trimmed to one spec (`spellfile_spec.lua`) with 3 high-value offline tests (no operation, download success, dual fail) and dropped the rest.

Thanks, pushed new updates. I originally used [#29552](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29552) as a reference for the tests. I aligned them with current conventions (rtp setup like `runtime_spec.lua` and using `t.eq`) and also addressed the rest of the feedback (forced utf-8, redundant code like checking for `uv.loop`..., _done made private). Let me know if you prefer a different test pattern for the test suite!

@justinmk For the sake of transparency: I did use AI assistance to help with the test cases, mainly reviewing them afterward to understand intent and make sure they ran correctly with what I expected. I should have signaled that earlier so you knew what to expect, sorry for wasting honest review efforts...I believe I incorporated the feedback as best as I can now. Just wanted to be upfront and thank you for your help!
